result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Suchomel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs within 60 days from today.

Commence within 60 days from today. 
Get jail start date today at the Sheriff's dept. 
Huber for work. 
May serve last 60 days on electronic monitoring, provided he meets Sheriff's requirements.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Prior: 1790 Strongs Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Andrew J. Suchomel in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases heard today are: 15CF8 & 15CF72
11:20 am. Court calls case.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney Sheets concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF8
Ct 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant Guilty on Ct 1 in 15CF8.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
Ct 2 in 15CF8 & 15CF72 are DRI.

Court proceeds without PSI.
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets concurs regarding sentencing recommendation and makes additional sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court asks the Defendant if he wants to make any statements.

BY THE COURT:
15CF8
Ct 1:
120 days jail 
Commence within 60 days from today. Get jail start date today at the Sheriff's dept.
Huber for work
May serve last 60 days on electronic monitoring provided meets Sheriff's requirements
Pay costs 60 days from today
1 day jail credit
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

3:38 p.m. Defendant Andrew J. Suchomel in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Knaapen calls witness, Robert Kussow, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. 
3:44 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Renc.
3:46 p.m. ADA Knaapen makes final statements in favor to find probable cause.
Court summarizes the facts presented.
BTC:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J. Suchomel in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Renc appears in court for this hearing only.  Defendant does qualify for the public defender but one has not yet been appointed. 

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
 
State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Renc makes bond arguments to the Court.
